page.title: 06ST PETERS CHURCH
page.content: Five thousand years ago the inhabitants of Yateley erected a sacred stone and in the seventh century the Saxons built a stone church on this spot on the directions of Pope Gregory. The stone was left in place to become the corner stone of the Christian Church. Then in the eighth century the Saxon church was sacked by the Danes only the lower three feet of the walls surviving. The Church was restored 1000 years ago by Aelfrige, Saxon Lord of Yateley. A Norman Lord enlarged it in the 11th Century. In 1979 an arsonist burned down the church, only the tower and vestry remaining. The Church has been carefully restored and stands as a witness to confirm a continuity of Christian life for a thousand years.
